item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 at 10:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. IMG_0001 (575 points | 73 comments)

3. A particle physics course for high-school students (119 points | 7 comments)
4. Egoless Engineering (524 points | 191 comments)
5. My son (9 yrs old) used plain JavaScript to make a game, and wants your feedback (574 points | 275 comments)
6. Show HN: Open-Source Colab Notebooks to Implement Advanced RAG Techniques (57 points | 7 comments)
7. Intel announces Arc B-series "Battlemage" discrete graphics with Linux support (414 points | 604 comments)
8. No Nat November: My Month Without IPv4 (123 points | 59 comments)
9. Glojure: Clojure interpreter hosted on Go, with extensible interop support (152 points | 27 comments)
10. Getting Started with Category Theory (15 points | 3 comments)
11. FTC takes action against Gravy Analytics, Venntel for selling location data (162 points | 128 comments)
12. Skia Canvas: Browserless implementation of the HTML Canvas drawing API for node (240 points | 73 comments)
13. Show HN: My C compiler compiled itself (163 points | 48 comments)
14. The Porsche Macan EV is being recalled because its headlights are too bright (70 points | 140 comments)
15. Making a parallel Rust workload 10x faster with (or without) Rayon (95 points | 23 comments)
16. The Tube Computer (175 points | 52 comments)
17. Gratitude despite the odds (42 points | 4 comments)
18. A new home for Python-build-standalone (84 points | 22 comments)
19. Dependency management fatigue, or why I ditched React for Go+HTMX+Templ (227 points | 219 comments)
20. Creating a Proxmox or QEMU ChromeOS Flex VM (64 points | 16 comments)
21. Pinecone integrates AI inferencing with vector database (6 points | 5 comments)
22. Dark Mode in CSS Guide (12 points | 1 comment)
23. Phoenix LiveView 1.0.0 is here (488 points | 82 comments)
24. Stephen King to shut down his 3 radio stations in Maine (96 points | 129 comments)
25. EmacsConf 2024 (116 points | 2 comments)
26. Voice Activity Detection in Elixir with Membran (29 points | 1 comment)
27. Phishers Love New TLDs Like .shop, .top and .xyz (135 points | 163 comments)
28. Making AWS News stupid fast with smart caching (21 points | 3 comments)
29. Openlayer (YC S21) is looking for top-tier design engineers ( | hide)
30. Formaldehyde Causes More Cancer Than Any Other Toxic Air Pollutant (111 points | 53 comments)
